channel.title: Changing the "::" to whatever you want!
channel.description:
Heya guys, havent seen a tutorial of this and since ive just done it (Didnt like ::). I am going to show you all how!... Kool huh?
Anyways to start off in your client files open "client.java" and search for: [code]"::"[/code]
Underneath you should see something like this: [code] if(aString887.startsWith("::")) { aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method397((byte)6, 103); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method398(aString887.length() - 1); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method405(aString887.substring(2));[/code]
So obviously first change the "::" to whatever you want your command starter to be... Now where it says 'aString887.length() - 1', not 100% sure what it does but if you have a 1 character command starter e.g. '/' than take away the one. Otherwise just leave it should work. Lastly for the client side we must modify the number in the 'substring(2)', simply change the '2' to the amount of characters in your command starter.
Sorry i do realize this is a 5 minute tutorial but ive NEVER seen this posted. Remove if you ABSOLUTELY MUST.

item.title: Changing the "::" to whatever you want!
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[code]notepad.exe > Ctrl+F > “::” > Find

Change “::” to: “WHATEVERYOUWANTRHECOMMANDPARAMETRETOBE”

Change XXX to WHATEVERYOU… lengh:
aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method405(aString887.substring(XXX));[/code]

That was SO hard.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing the "::" to whatever you want!

item.title: Changing the "::" to whatever you want!
item.dc:creator: @Stupid_Ninja Stupid Ninja
item.description:
@Stupid_Ninja wrote:

Heya guys, havent seen a tutorial of this and since ive just done it (Didnt like ::). I am going to show you all how!.. Kool huh?

Anyways to start off in your client files open “client.java” and search for:

"::"

Underneath you should see something like this:

if(aString887.startsWith("::")) { aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method397((byte)6, 103); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method398(aString887.length() - 1); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method405(aString887.substring(2));

So obviously first change the “::” to whatever you want your command starter to be…
Now where it says ‘aString887.length() - 1’, not 100% sure what it does but if you have a 1 character command starter e.g. ‘/’ than take away the one. Otherwise just leave it should work.
Lastly for the client side we must modify the number in the ‘substring(2)’, simply change the ‘2’ to the amount of characters in your command starter.

Sorry i do realize this is a 5 minute tutorial but ive NEVER seen this posted. Remove if you ABSOLUTELY MUST.
